top_categories.workout_context: Transcordilleras' Colombian Andes, South American gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 120 miles.
125ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Transcordilleras, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Transcordilleras' demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before race day.
At mile 60 of 120, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
15,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
15,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Transcordilleras. Train it until it feels boring.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 120 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Transcordilleras, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Low-cadence force work for 15,000ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
120 miles rewards fat oxidation. This volume work shifts your fuel mix so you're still burning fat at hour 5, not bonking at hour 3.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Transcordilleras’s 120 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Transcordilleras with 15,000ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. High altitude.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Transcordilleras demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride colombian andes mountain gravel at race-day cadence weekly. Expect: colombian andes, south american gravel, regional event. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 120 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, TT Threshold, and Over Under to prepare you for 120 miles of colombian andes mountain gravel in Colombian Andes, Colombia.
